get.summary:
Searches messages within a specific thread.
Supports cursor-based pagination and field selection.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of message fields to be returned.
Used to reduce payload size.

parameters.name: sender_ids
parameters.description: Filter messages by sender user IDs.

parameters.name: receiver_ids
parameters.description: Filter messages by receiver user IDs.

parameters.name: domain_id
parameters.description: Domain identifier used to data isolation.

parameters.name: cursor.direction
parameters.description:
Pagination direction.
true - backward (older messages).
false - forward (newer messages).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Represents a request to send a message with document.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Represents a request to send an message with image.

post.summary:
SendText delivers a plain text message.
We use the shared Request/Response types directly to avoid duplication.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Represents a request to send a text message.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

after.description: Cursor pointing to the next page of results.

before.description: Cursor pointing to the previous page of results.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Cursors.description:
Cursors contains for navigating
forward and backward through message history.

message_id.description: Identifier of the message this document belongs to.

url.description: Public signed URL for downloading the document.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Document.description:
Document represents a file attachment
associated with a message.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.DocumentInput.description:
Represents `Document` message with necessary fields
to process it into frequently used `document`
entity in messaging systems.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread the message belongs to.

metadata.description:
Arbitrary message metadata.
Can contain structured data depending on message type.

updated_at.description: Message last update timestamp (Unix time, milliseconds).

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.HistoryMessage.description:
HistoryMessage represents a single message
in thread history.

direction.description:
Pagination direction.
true - backward (older messages).
false - forward (newer messages).

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.HistoryMessage.description:
HistoryMessageCursor represents a cursor used for
cursor based pagination of message history.

message_id.description: Identifier of the message this message belongs to.

url.description: Public signed URL for accessing the image.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Image.description:
Image represents an image attachment
associated with a message.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.Peer.description:
Represents a peer in the messaging system.
It can be a user, chat, or channel.

messages.description: List of messages matching the search criteria.

next_cursor.description: Cursor pointing to the next page of messages.

next.description: Indicates whether more messages are available.

from.description: List of unique sender IDs present in the response.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SearchMessageH.description:
SearchMessageHistoryResponse contains
message history search results and pagination metadata.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendDocumentRe.description: Represents a request to send a message with document.
Represents a response to send message with document.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendImageReque.description: Represents a request to send an message with image.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendImageRespo.description: Represents a response to send message with image.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendTextReques.description: Represents a request to send a text message.

webitel.im.api.gateway.v1.SendTextRespon.description: Represents a response to send a text message.
